result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen T. Montgomery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephen T. Montgomery is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephen T. Montgomery was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Stephen T. Montgomery was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Stephen T. Montgomery was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: *Defendant's Attorney in agreement with the charges being dismissed outright

charges.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Videos, Records, etc.

chargeModifiers.descr: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders

supervisions.notes:
*Zero days of jail credit
*Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
*Not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Count 4 & 6

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay all court ordered financial obligations 90 days prior to discharge and set up a payment plan so he can accomplish that 
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay $500 Pornography Surcharge
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

*Comply with Sex Offender Registry
*Comply with any psychological assessment and treatment recommendations to address the sexual addiction or treatment that he needs.  This includes taking any medications as recommended by the physician as long as they are reasonable.
*No contact with minors without prior agent approval 
*Any internet usage to be determined and approved by the agent in advance 
*Comply with Sex Offender treatment recommendations 
*Comply with any other assessments, treatment or programming as deemed appropriate by the department or his agent 
*Sign all releases or information for treatment providers so agent can monitor assessment and compliance 
*Provide a DNA sample, if not already completed
*No contact with M.K.

IT IS ORDERED that the time to file a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is hereby extended to July 30, 2018

Attorney Kirk Bowden Obear in court.  Defendant Stephen T. Montgomery appeared by video, from Red Granite Institution.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:42 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Court put this matter on the docket after receiving a letter from the Department of Corrections. They believe that Defendant should be placed on lifetime supervision after reviewing the Judgment of Conviction.
Atty Obear wrote a letter to the Court indicating the Court did not order lifetime supervision. The enhancer includes the lifetime supervision.

Court reviewed the transcript. There was no request for lifetime supervision. This was not brought up by either attorney.

Court is inclined to have the lifetime supervision modifier removed from the judgment of conviction.

State has no objection.

Court states findings for the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not order lifetime supervision
Court orders Judgment of Conviction be amended to delete the lifetime supervision language.

(Clerk: eliminate the modifier)
Motion for Extension of Time to File Its Notice of Appeal filed by Atty Kirk Obear
Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on March 6, 2018
Review hearing on July 3, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
from Atty Obear
from DOC
from the State Public Defender/Appellate Division dated 03/20/18 in re:  documentation sent in "error" as defendant has retained counsel

filed by Atty Kirk Obear
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephen T. Montgomery in court with attorney Kirk Bowden Obear. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:33 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court has received letters as stated on the record.  
Atty Zell has not received copies of those. 
Copies are provided by Atty Obear. 
Atty Zell will review those as the proceeding continues. 

Court has received the PSI. 
Atty Zell has received a copy of the PSI and has no corrections. 
Atty Obear has received a copy of the PSI and reviewed that with his client.  He has no factual corrections but disagrees with some information in there and will address those during his argument. 

Atty Zell makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Obear makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Obear. 
Atty Obear responds.  Makes additional statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Serve a determinate term of 15 years prison with 5 years initial confinement followed by 10 years extended supervision on each count, concurrent with each other. 
0 days jail credit.
Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
Comply with any psychological assessment and treatment recommendations to address the sexual addiction or treatment that he needs. 
That includes taking any medications as recommended by the physician as long as they are reasonable.
No contact with minors without prior agent approval.
Any internet usage to be determined and approved by agent in advance. 
Comply with any Sex Offender treatment recommendations.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment or programming as deemed appropriate by the department or his agent.
Sign all releases of information for treatment providers so agent can monitor assessment and compliance.
Pay all court ordered obligations 90 days prior to discharge and set up a payment plan so he can accomplish that. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already completed.
No contact with M.K. 
Pay costs on each of these counts including the DNA surcharge.
$500 pornography surcharge for the image in each of the counts for which he is convicted. 

Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program. 

Defendant is remanded to the custody of the sheriff. 

Court provides the defendant with written explanation of determinate sentence. 
20 days in which to appeal.
Additional Character Letter filed on behalf of Stephen T. Montgomery filed by Atty Kirk B Obear - sent to JR on 03/05/18 sp
Detailed Summary of Military Service filed on behalf of Stephen T. Montgomery by Atty Kirk B Obear - sent to JR for review on 03/05/18 sp
Character Letters filed on Behalf of Stephen Montgomery  - sent to JR on 03/01/18 sp

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 5, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Stephen T. Montgomery in court with attorney Kirk Bowden Obear. Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:36 a.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
No sentencing today as both parties would be requesting a PSI.
State would argue for 5 years of initial confinement; 10 years of extended supervision with Lifetime Supervision at the sentencing.
State will not requet a remand pending the sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Dismissed 
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - Dismissed 
Count 4 - No contest
Count 5 - Dismissed 
Count 6 - No contest 
Count 7 - Dismissed 
Count 8 - Dismissed 
Count 9 - Dismissed 
Count 10 - Dismissed 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2, 4 & 6 and Count's 1, 3, 5, 7, 8, 9 & 10 will be dismissed outright.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
PSI ordered 
PSI to be provided to the parties at lease one week prior to the sentencing
Bond is continued

Defendant Stephen T. Montgomery in court with attorney Kirk Bowden Obear. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:33 PM Court calls case.

Matter is before the Court for a preliminary hearing.

Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Knaapen states that Defendant will be waiving his right.

Atty Obear concurs, waiver form has been filled out. 

Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney Obear.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.
No contact with M.C.  or A. C. or residences.  No unsupervised with any minor females under the age of 18.

Defendant Stephen T. Montgomery in court with attorney Kirk Bowden Obear. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Court sets cash bond.
Time limits waived for prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
